text.base: There is no sky. There is only the hum. It starts in the marrow of your bones, a vibration that matches the resonant frequency of your pain. The light isn't coming from above; it's coming from *inside* your optic nerve. You are being unmade. Your first birthday party. The taste of lemons. The face of your mother. They are being deleted, one by one.

lens.believer: It's not an invasion. It's an answer. Finally, the question marks in your DNA are being straightened into exclamation points. The song is beautiful.
lens.skeptic: Stroke. A massive hemorrhagic event in the occipital lobe. You are dying. This is just the firing of neurons as they starve. Fight the shutdown.
lens.haunted: The ghosts aren't screaming anymore. They are silent. Because they are afraid of *this*. Even the dead know when to hide.

choices.label: Open the door. (Let it in.)
choices.description: The pain stops. The you stops. You become part of the chorus.

on_success.text: You bite your tongue until you taste copper. The pain is yours. The fear is yours. You are small, and fragile, and *real*. The light recoils from the density of your existence. You keep the memory of the lemons.

on_fail.text: The anchor drags through the silt of your mind. It finds no purchase. You drift away.
